page.title: 07Transport - Roads
page.content: The region is crossed by the A249 trunk road which links the M2 motorway with Sheerness Docks. In the last twelve years the Docks have grown rapidly and whilst some of the freight goes by rail most seems to be carted by lorry. Recent surveys by the children of Iwade have shown at peak times that well over 2000 vehicles an hour use the road of which 25% are heavy lorries. The A249 is not adequate to cope with this volume of traffic. An Iwade by-pass is planned to be built and it is hoped that the village will be told the route in the late summer of 1985. A B2005 road links Sittingbourne with the A249 and passes through Grovehurst. This road too is very busy and between Grovehurst and Iwade ther is no pavement. A large investment program is needed to improve the area roads.
